> Now you can run the test suite from the eclipse correctly.
> I think this method is not good for use the annotation of junit4.
> But it would ok for using the eclipse. Maybe this is what you want
> "an alternative enabling the building of a test suite dynamically".

In Eclipse 3.2.1, you can just get it to run all tests its finds in
your project, regardless of the junit versions, but you do have to
specify if it should run them as Junit 4 or 3.x
